      • add

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.Object obj,
       LifecycleMethods methods)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Add the object to the container. Its assets will be loaded, post construct methods called, etc. This version helps performance when the lifecycle methods have already been calculated
        Parameters:
        obj - object to add
        methods - calculated lifecycle methods
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - errors

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        The manager MUST be started. Note: this method waits indefinitely for warm up methods to complete
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - errors

      • start

        public boolean start(long maxWait,
            java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        The manager MUST be started. This version of start() has a maximum wait period for warm up methods.
        Parameters:
        maxWait - maximum wait time for warm up methods - if the time elapses, the warm up methods are interrupted
        unit - time unit
        Returns:
        true if warm up methods successfully executed, false if the time elapses
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - errors

      • validate

        public void validate()
              throws ValidationException
        Run the validations on the managed objects. This is done automatically when start() is called. But you can call this at any time you need.
        Throws:
        ValidationException
